channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Alcaraz beats Djokovic to become the youngest man to complete a career Grand Slam
item.description: The 22-year-old Spaniard's win against 38-year-old rival Novak Djokovic at Sunday's Australian Open makes him the youngest male player to win all four major tournaments.
item.content:encoded:
The 22-year-old Spaniard's win against 38-year-old rival Novak Djokovic at Sunday's Australian Open makes him the youngest male player to win all four major tournaments.

(Image credit: Mark Baker)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: At a clown school near Paris, failure is the lesson
item.description: For decades, students at the Ecole Philippe Gaulier have been paying to bomb onstage. The goal isn't laughs — it's learning how to take the humiliation and keep going.
item.content:encoded:
For decades, students at the Ecole Philippe Gaulier have been paying to bomb onstage. The goal isn't laughs — it's learning how to take the humiliation and keep going.

(Image credit: Rebecca Rosman for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: In the world's driest desert, Chile freezes its future to protect plants
item.description: Tucked away in a remote desert town, a hidden vault safeguards Chile's most precious natural treasures. From long-forgotten flowers to endangered crops.
item.content:encoded:
Tucked away in a remote desert town, a hidden vault safeguards Chile's most precious natural treasures. From long-forgotten flowers to endangered crops.

(Image credit: John Bartlett)
item.dc:creator: John Bartlett

item.title: Iran's supreme leader warns any US attack would spark 'regional war'
item.description: Iran's supreme leader warned Sunday that any attack by the United States would spark a "regional war" in the Mideast, further escalating tensions as President Donald Trump has threatened to militarily strike the Islamic Republic.
item.content:encoded:
Iran's supreme leader warned Sunday that any attack by the United States would spark a "regional war" in the Mideast, further escalating tensions as President Donald Trump has threatened to militarily strike the Islamic Republic.

(Image credit: Seaman Daniel Kimmelman)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Minnesota citizens detained by ICE are left rattled, even weeks later
item.description: The number of immigration agents in Minnesota may be reduced, but they'll leave leave behind a changed community, including many U.S. citizens questioned and detained in recent weeks.
item.content:encoded:
The number of immigration agents in Minnesota may be reduced, but they'll leave leave behind a changed community, including many U.S. citizens questioned and detained in recent weeks.

(Image credit: Adam Gray/AP)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Gaza border crossing buzzes with activity after years of near-complete closure
item.description: Reopening the border crossing is a key step as the Israel-Hamas ceasefire moves ahead.
item.content:encoded:
Reopening the border crossing is a key step as the Israel-Hamas ceasefire moves ahead.

(Image credit: Mohammed Arafat)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Democrat Taylor Rehmet wins a reliably Republican Texas state Senate seat, stunning GOP
item.description: Democrat Taylor Rehmet won a special election for the Texas state Senate on Saturday, flipping a reliably Republican district that President Donald Trump won by 17 points in 2024.
item.content:encoded:
Democrat Taylor Rehmet won a special election for the Texas state Senate on Saturday, flipping a reliably Republican district that President Donald Trump won by 17 points in 2024.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump says feds won't intervene during protests in Democratic-led cities unless asked to do so
item.description: President Donald Trump said Saturday that he has instructed Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem not to intervene in protests occurring in cities led by Democrats unless local authorities ask for federal help.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump said Saturday that he has instructed Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem not to intervene in protests occurring in cities led by Democrats unless local authorities ask for federal help.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: U.S. intervention in Venezuela divides Houston
item.description: In nearly two dozen interviews, Houstonians expressed everything from admiration and relief to skepticism and dread following the seizure of leader Nicolás Maduro.
item.content:encoded:
In nearly two dozen interviews, Houstonians expressed everything from admiration and relief to skepticism and dread following the seizure of leader Nicolás Maduro.

(Image credit: Danielle Villasana for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt

item.title: Anti-ICE protesters call for national action against federal immigration tactics
item.description: Hundreds of groups hold protests against federal immigration operations, calling for an end to ICE surge. Demonstrators challenge Minneapolis-based retailer Target.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of groups hold protests against federal immigration operations, calling for an end to ICE surge. Demonstrators challenge Minneapolis-based retailer Target.

(Image credit: Kristin Wright/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright
